page.title: 01BROUGHTON: an introduction
page.content: Broughton is situated on a small tributary of the{River Test.}The village has a population of about one thousand. It has a{High Street}where the shops and pubs are. The unusual aspects of Broughton are the{chalk {walls,}the number of{little paths} running between buildings and gardens and there are quite a few{hand pumps dotted around the village. Broughton is a lively village; it has many organisations. The village has beautiful surrounding countryside.{Broughton {Down}is the main attraction;{the {Hampshire and Isle of Wight Naturalist {Trust}have a{reserve}there. It has many rare{flowers}and{butterflies}in it. The{Wallop Brook,}a tributary of the {River Test,}flows through the village.
